clinical_study.brief_title: Therapy Strategies After LAA Occluder Device Embolization
clinical_study.official_title: Device Embolization After Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Occlusion: Risk Factors, Approaches and Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators thought to evaluate risk factors, therapeutic approaches and outcomes after left atrial appendage occluder device embolization (LAAO, either surgical or interventional).

detailed_description.textblock:
The global burden of atrial fibrillation (AF) is high, and AF represents a major cause of morbidity, mortality and health-care expenditure. Thromboembolic stroke may be one of the fatal complications and oral anticoagulation has been the mainstay therapy for decades to mitigate stroke risk. However, in poor candidates for long-term anticoagulation (i.e. high bleeding risk, poor drug tolerance or adherence), non- pharmacological stroke prevention with percutaneous left atrial appendage occlusion (LAAO) is a considerable treatment option.
Occluders are implanted into the left atrial appendage (LAA) but they might dislocate and therefore embolize subsequently. In this case, surgical or percutaneous removal of the device may be indicated. Depending on the patient's status, implanting another device can be an alternative to returning to anticoagulation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: In-hospital stay, assessed up to 30 days
primary_outcome.description: all-cause mortality during the index procedure, any procedure-related death within 30days or during in-hospital stay for the index procedure (if>30days)

primary_outcome.time_frame: In-hospital stay, assessed up to 30 days

secondary_outcome.description: Any other complications after device embolization (i.e., thromboembolic events, circulatory problems, CPR etc.)
Favoring conditions for LAAO device dislocation (e.g., anatomical risk factors, risk factors related to the initial procedure)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients experiencing device embolization after left atrial appendage occlusion
arm_group.description: Device embolization following either surgical or interventional left atrial appendage occlusion

intervention.intervention_name: Removal or leaving of LAA occluders
intervention.description: After LAA device embolization there are different approaches to dealing with the occluder dislocation. The aim is to find out which way leads to the best outcomes.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients experiencing device embolization after left atrial appendage occlusion

study_pop.textblock: Patients after interventional or surgical left atrial appendage occlusion with device embolization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients after interventional or surgical left atrial appendage occlusion with device embolization
Exclusion Criteria:
- n/a
